fields.description:
Access the "Contact Administrators" page, e.g. from the forgotten password screen.

To access this page, if Web Sudo is turned on you must first log in, then are prompted to enter your password again.

This is a problem because:
# It prevents anonymous users from viewing the page (so is useless for the forgotten password scenario)
# The page is intended for normal user access, not for administrators. 
# It also will show users the message "You have temporary access to administrative functions" which is misleading, and could be cause for concern.

The page *should* be accessible by normal users and by anonymous users, and *should not* be protected by web sudo.
fields.summary: Web Sudo: Contact Site Administrators page requires web sudo

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-19865].
  {panel}

Some of our users prefer the old (pre-Confluence-3.0) behavior with thumbnails, where clicking on the thumbnail would display the full-size image in a separate window.

The current behavior is to zoom the image over the page.  This is nice for some images, jerky and slow for other images.  But most importantly, it places the image over the page, and in many cases the point is to be able to view the image (like a screenshot for instructions) side-by-side with the text describing it.

We would like to see a parameter to the image idiom that duplicates the old behavior.

Or possibly, the ability to turn this feature off on a space-by-space basis, or possibly Confluence-wide (in the same way that we can set the thumbnail size).
fields.summary: Allow old thumbnail behavior (display image in separate window)

fields.description:
Hi guys,

I was reviewing the email that we send to new customers that includes their invoice. In the email we say:

{quote}
Once logged in, click "View License" then copy and paste the license key into your instance
{quote}

I am proposing we include a link to product specific documentation with instructions of how to update your license key in the product.

That led me to find this doc:

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Viewing+and+Editing+License+Details

Could we update it so it has the same structure as the JIRA doc:

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Updating+your+JIRA+License+Details

Cheers,
Matt
fields.summary: Update 'Viewing and Editing License Details' documentation

fields.description: Would like to be able to insert in Confluence lists of JASE Jira issues, as already possible with Jira.
fields.summary: Embed JASE (Jira Application Support Environment) issue summaries

fields.description:
I've set Jira to trust Confluence, and put 127.0.0.1 with the ip address matches (Jira somehow automatically added 127.0.1.1).
In the URL Paths to Allow, I've set:
{code}/sr/jira.issueviews:searchrequest
/secure/RunPortlet
/rest{code}

When I enter a jiraissues macro in Confluence, I get an error:
{code}Errors were reported by the JIRA trusted connection.
BAD_REMOTE_IP; Request not allowed from IP address: {0}; ["127.0.0.1"]{code}
But the ip address 127.0.0.1 is configured in Jira.

I've followed several pieces of documentation, but none supplied an answer to my problem.
* [http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Setting+Up+Trusted+Communication+between+JIRA+and+Confluence]
* [http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Configuring+Trusted+Applications]
* [http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Integrating+JIRA+and+Confluence]
fields.summary: Jiraissues macro: BAD_REMOTE_IP

fields.description:
Hi,

We have Jira 3.13 and Confluence 3.2 each installed in a standalone installation.

Confluence is using Jira user database.

Randomly, users take too much time to login.

in the logs after put in diagnosis mode it appears while the user is waiting for a response:


2010-06-01 16:47:35,761 DEBUG [http-8081-6] [bucket.user.providers.CachingProfileProvider] handles Found cached handles() lookup for username

We have followed all the procedures in http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Delegate+user+management+to+use+JIRA+logins

and also confluence datasource has: autoReconnect=true

Can you please indicate which is the reason for this behavior?

Thanks
fields.summary: Log in takes too much time in Confluence

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-19838].
  {panel}

To reproduce, follow the instructions from the [documentation|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Widget+Macro#WidgetMacro-Dailymotion]. The videos do not work. Perhaps they've changed their URL structure. We should either remove support for this or fix the bug.

{quote}To find a Dailymotion video's URL:

   1. Go to Dailymotion and search for the video you want.
   2. Click the title of the video, such as 'Wiki Technology Trend: Past, Now and Future'.
   3. The video's summary page will open. Copy the URL from the address bar of your browser. The URL looks something like this:
      1.http://www.dailymotion.com/user/spacevidcast/video/x7zevj_spacevidcast-2009-promo-video_tech

      If you are unable to obtain a unique URL from your browser's address bar, click Menu at the lower right section of the video screen, select URL & Embed Code and copy the contents of the Link field.
   4. Paste the URL into the Widget macro code on your Confluence page.

Here is an example of the Widget macro code for embedding a Dailymotion video:
1.{widget:http://www.dailymotion.com/user/spacevidcast/video/x7zevj_spacevidcast-2009-promo-video_tech}{quote}
fields.summary: DailyMotion doesn't work in the Widget Macro

fields.description:
To reproduce:
# Edit a page in the RTE
# Start the autocomplete (say) for a link, wait until the drop-down appears
# Click in some whitespace outside of the editor

The dropdown will display but leave the autocomplete search box and the little Raphael triangle that was attached to the drop-down. Either the drop-down should stay when clicking away, or (more likely) the autocomplete should be torn down when its drop-down is hidden.

Note that the drop-down is not being destroyed, only hidden (you can still find it in the DOM).
fields.summary: Editor Autocomplete doesn't close properly when user clicks away from editor

fields.description: At the moment the property panel call-out does not align if the item it is displaying the property for is on the edge of the editor.
fields.summary: Property panel call-out does not align when the item we are displaying properties for is on the edge of the editor

fields.description:
Bamboo has an out-of-disk-space condition on the server, causing it to become unresponsive.

Confluence is trying to get information from the unresponsive Bamboo server, which causes it to also hang.

Possible causes are

* Gadget timeout problem (http request to external resource used to not have a default timeout, causing sockets to stay open indefinitely if the external resource responded to the request but didn't close the socket. This could be a regression for specifically gadgets or trusted gadgets)
* Trust requests could not time out,
fields.summary: Trusted Apps: Confluence hangs when a trusting Bamboo instance goes down

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

# Create one or several custom fields in JIRA and create an issue that uses said fields.
# Create a page in Confluence and add the JIRA Issues Macro and specify the custom fields under Field Columns.
# The macro will display whatever contents are in the 'stringvalue' column of the customfieldvalue table.

\\
For cascading fields, it will display two numerical values referencing the customfiledoption table.  For free text fields, an empty set is returned.

Edit: (March 2, 2010) Affects and Fix Version/s will also display a referential numerical value from the database table in place of the actual version number.
fields.summary: Issues Macro cannot display values in custom fields

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-19827].
  {panel}

With this feature request, a user should be able to:

* Attach files, and select them.
* You can click on any image and add a comment
* You can drag&drop and move the order
* You can add more columns and columns inside columns
* At editing you could add a Tag and make all images Movable, and simple comment add just by clicking.

If anything else is important please add.

Guilherme Heck,
Atlassian Support
fields.summary: Drag&Drop Gallery Macro Organizer

fields.description:
h5. Steps to reproduce
# Attach an image with different mime type. For example: image/x-citrix-pjpeg.
# If you don't have an image with that mime type, just attach any image and change the mime type to image/x-citrix-pjpeg. You can perform that from Dashboard > <space-name> >  <page-name> > Attachments > Properties
# After 1 minute (for indexing purpose), when you search for the image, there won't be a thumbnail displayed for the search result.
# The image (with image/x-citrix-pjpeg mime type) can be displayed fine in Confluence pages as thumbnails.
# Screenshot attached:
#* [^Search result.png]
fields.summary: Search results not displaying thumbnails for some images (different mime types)

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-19818].
  {panel}

There are currently a few known issues that relate to different URLs used other than the Confluence base URL when performing Confluence functions:

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/Various+Issues+Caused+when+Server+Base+URL+Does+Not+Match+the+URL+Used+to+Access+Confluence

This configuration is commonly called "multi-homing". There are two different configurations for this:

- "Simple multi-homing": changes to the scheme (http/https), host name or port on different aliases
- "Advanced multi-homing": changes to the path of the application on different aliases.

Confluence does *not* support either of the two configurations above. It has been agreed that Confluence will not at support *Advanced multi-homing*. There is, however an opportunity for Confluence to support simple multi-homing.

This request is to support simple multi-homing.
fields.summary: Support accessing Confluence from alias that is different to the server base URL

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-19815].
  {panel}

When exporting large spaces as PDF, there's a big performance issue. When Confluence starts converting the collected pages to PDF, the application becomes unavailable for the users. After some time, there's a _java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: Java heap space_ in the atlassian-confluence.log.

The _OutOfMemoryError_ problem might be fixed by increasing the size of the heap space.

There some options though, like:

# Possibility of running the PDF export at off-hours, on a synchronized job.
# Attachment Size. Limiting it by size and type, finding large attachments.
# Pages not included in the PDF be moved to a separate space (also relevant for (1) above).
fields.summary: Slow Performance in PDF Export

fields.description:
When exporting large spaces as PDF, there's a big performance issue. When Confluence starts converting the collected pages to PDF, the application becomes unavailable for the users. After some time, there's a _java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: Java heap space_ in the atlassian-confluence.log.

The _OutOfMemoryError_ problem can be fixed by increasing the Xmx from 1024m to 2048m.

There some options though, like:

# Possibility of running the PDF export at off-hours, on a synchronized job.
# Attachment Size. Limiting it by size and type, finding large attachments.
# Pages not included in the PDF be moved to a separate space (also relevant for (1) above).
fields.summary: Slow Performance in PDF Export

fields.description:
Raising on behalf of our Confluence customer:

The german translation of the "Can Use" permission is completely confusing (Confluence 3.2.1). "darf Folgendes verwenden" means "Can use following". I thought "following" referred to the permissions on the right when it actually means if you don't have this permission you won't be able to log into Confluence. It is on the other hand translated correctly on the right side where the help is displayed as "Confluence verwenden" which just means "Use Confluence" and makes much more sense than that confusing following stuff.
fields.summary: Wrong German translation for "Can Use" permission

fields.description:
When clicking the link to drop access to web sudo, the user is redirected to the Dashboard.

This makes sense when the user is leaving an admin screen. But if the user has browsed to a non-admin screen, then clicks the link, this can be very annoying.

It would be better if the user remains on the current page after clicking the link.
fields.summary: Web Sudo: Usability: Drop access should not redirect to the Dashboard

fields.description:
It might be a deliberate design decision, but I find it odd that when entering a password incorrectly to Web Sudo, there is no feedback.

If the user is waiting for something to happen, not realising that they have mis-typed, this seems confusing.

I don't think it takes away from the security of the feature to alert the user that the entered password was incorrect.
fields.summary: Web Sudo: Usability: There is no feedback given when entering a password incorrectly

* Click on the image, and change the size using the property panel


The image will now show a broken image symbol.

It displays correctly when the page is saved.

* Type '!' and the name of an image
* Insert the image

The inserted image gives a broken image symbol.

When saving the page it loads correctly.

fields.description:
Navigate to an admin page, and you are prompted for a password.

The focus is not in the text field, so the user must first click it or tab to it, then type the password.

It would be much better if the focus was already in the text field to minimise the annoyance to the user.
fields.summary: Web Sudo: Usability: Focus should be in the password field when trying to use web sudo

fields.description:
Navigate to an Admin page, and enter the admin password.

A banner now appears, with text:

{noformat}You have temporary access to administrative functions, drop access or learn more.
{noformat}

This should be rewritten - split into two sentences? Check with tech writers.
fields.summary: Web Sudo: Banner text is strangely phrased

fields.description:
The current description "The default e-mail address populated in the To field when an Administrator creates a support request" can be misunderstood. Suggest changing to:

"The default e-mail address populated in the To field when an Administrator creates a support request from within Confluence"

OR

"The default e-mail address populated in the To field when an Administrator creates a support request through the Support Utility"

fields.description:
Here are the steps on how to reproduce this bug:
*Normal behavior*
# Create a Test page in any space 
# In Rich Text mode, put in some contents in the page like:
{noformat}
test 1
test 2
bla bla
meh meh
{noformat}
# Clicking on any part of the content and pressing the 'Delete' key works alright in any browser

*Undesired behavior*
# Using any IE browser (6/7/8), with the same page in Rich Text mode, click on Wiki Markup mode and then click back to Rich Text mode
# There will be a space in between those content:
{noformat}
test 1

test 2

bla bla

meh meh
{noformat}
# Clicking between the space and press on the 'Delete' key (it just hangs there without any response)
# In Firefox, there is no space in between the content and pressing on the 'Delete' key works fine

Besides, clicking on in between the words and pressing on 'Delete' key works fine in any IE browser. However, typing any new words and then click your mouse cursor below the word, you will see that the cursor will go down when you press on the 'Delete' key.

This behavior is seen in Confluence 2.10.3 and Confluence 3.2.x.
fields.summary: Blank lines cannot be removed when pressing the 'Delete' key in IE6, IE7, and IE8

fields.description:
h4. Symptoms

When trying to remove a user, we get the following stack trace:

{noformat}
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at com.atlassian.confluence.core.DefaultContentPermissionManager.removeContentPermission(DefaultContentPermissionManager.java:167)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.core.DefaultContentPermissionManager.removeContentPermissions(DefaultContentPermissionManager.java:204)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.core.DefaultContentPermissionManager.removeAllUserPermissions(DefaultContentPermissionManager.java:196)
	at sun.reflect.GeneratedMethodAccessor8176.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:597)
	at org.springframework.aop.support.AopUtils.invokeJoinpointUsingReflection(AopUtils.java:304)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.invokeJoinpoint(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:182)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:149)
	at org.springframework.transaction.interceptor.TransactionInterceptor.invoke(TransactionInterceptor.java:106)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:171)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.JdkDynamicAopProxy.invoke(JdkDynamicAopProxy.java:204)
	at $Proxy13.removeAllUserPermissions(Unknown Source)

{noformat}

The reason for this is because the user exists in the content_perm table with CPS_ID = null.

eg:
id	cp_type	username	groupname	cps_id	creator	creationdate	lastmodifier	lastmoddate
491537	View	dbrown	(null)	(null)	dbrown	2008-05-31 23:08:02	(null)	2008-06-01 11:44:50


h4. Workaround

Run the sql command:

{code:sql}
delete from content_perm where cps_id is null; 
{code}

Then go to Administration > Cache Statistics > Advanced > 'Flush All'

Then try and remove that user again.
fields.summary: Null pointer exception when removing users that exist in the Content_perm table with CPS_ID = null

fields.summary: Excerpt-include macro does not support profile pages

fields.description:
The PPTX Edit in Office feature is not working for Firefox, nothing happens when the user click on 'Edit in Office' link.

To reproduce this behavior, perform the following steps using Firefox:
# attach a .pptx to a page
# click on 'Attachments' link in 'Tools' menu
# click on 'Edit in Office' link
# Nothing happens

Using IE or a .ppt file, this feature works fine. Also, no errors are shown in the log.
fields.summary: Edit in Office is not working with pptx in Firefox

fields.description: I'm attempting to edit an excel spreadsheet attachment from a Confluence page. Online doc states that I should be able to open, edit, and save back to confluence. I can open the file, but when i attempt to save, i get a message stating that the file is read only and that I have to save a local copy. I saw the issue that exists between Confluence and an earlier version of the Scaffolding plugin, but my confluence version is 3.1 and Scaffolding version is 3.4.1
fields.summary: Unable to edit an Excel spreadsheet and save back to confluence.
